alert.note: Alert for Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 516 PM EDT, Although the rain has stopped, some residual minor flooding may continue for the next hour as storm water drains. A CoCoRAHS report from 4:38PM reported 2 inches of rain from these storms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chapel Hill, Carrboro and Eno River State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
